About Pula, Croatia

Monarch Air Group offers private jet charter services to and from Pula, Croatia.

On the west coast of the Adriatic Sea lies Pula, a colorful city in Croatia with a population of fifty-seven thousand people. Travelers worldwide are attracted by the picturesque beaches and beautifully landscaped resort area of ancient Pula, founded by the Greeks.

Pula is suitable for both relaxing holidays with family and for those who like active beach entertainment. There are important historical sights in the city center, such as the amphitheater called the Colosseum of Croatia, which the Romans built in the 1st century B.C. To see the whole town and the surrounding area, guests can climb the tower in the fortress Ka≈°tel, where the Historical Maritime Museum is located. The Church of St. Nicholas, which attracts tourists and pilgrims with its many religious artifacts from the 15th century, is considered a unique place. The local Green Garden park is suitable for holidays with children, and you can go karting and participate in competitions.

Four miles from the center of Poole is a large civilian Pula Airport (PUY, LDPL), which takes more than 700 thousand passengers each year, including customers of private charters.
